p: Terpenoids from plant oils prevent tumor cell proliferation through necrosis or induction of apoptosis [ 35]. Germacrene D is reported as cytotoxic against cervical carcinoma (HeLa), leukemia (HL-60), colon carcinoma (HCT), breast adenocarcinoma (SKBr), and melanoma (A2058) [ 36]. β-Caryophyllene and caryophyllene oxide displayed activity against several tumor cells such as breast cancer (MCF-7), colon cancer (HCT-116), and human prostate (PC-3) [ 37, 38]. The values of IC 50 of bicyclogermacrene, α-pinene, and β-pinene against MCF-7 cells were 19.0, 30.7, and 80.2 µg/mL, respectively [ 24, 39].
